title: ajiz138
author: ajiz138
content: I did a google search for the word sinbad and found this site to look like a clone, and it's underneath the original sinbad.io advert, so pretty sure it's a fake site.I checked the status of the domain and it's only 22 days old while the original one is much older.There are no onion sites in this clone site.Contact, different from the official one.Site: sinbad-mixer.ioSinbad OfficialSinbad cloneIt almost looks the same as the minimum deposit of 0.001BTC but when you continue it changes to 0.00289176 BTC

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Thanks for the heads up, @ajiz138. I just checked it out and I agree with you - the site looks almost identical to Sinbad mixer. Given that it is a clone site, it is highly likely that it is a scam. We should definitely avoid it.We have seen this happening many times before - scammers creating clone sites to trick people into giving them money. It is always important to be vigilant and to double-check the legitimacy of any site before entering any personal or financial information or depositing money. It is always better to be safe than sorry.

comments.author: examplens
comments.body: it is certainly a clone site and you should not even think of using it, just needs to be reported. it is not a problem to enter parameters such as the minimum deposit, but for example, there is no link to the TOR page in the header, nor is there a PGP key like on the original page.Fake:Original:Also difference in the footerFake:Original:

comments.author: BitcoinGirl.Club
comments.body: Quote from: ajiz138 on April 07, 2023, 06:49:09 PMso pretty sure it's a fake site.Obvious it's a fake site and giving their URL on the title and in the text on the forum which is a high authority domain, we are just giving it a search engine back-link to rank it up. The scammer already successfully ranked his domain for the keyword Sinbad or you would not find it.

comments.author: boyptc
comments.body: Great find.We all know how hot the mixers are today and with a bunch of it having their signature campaigns in the forum, that adds more popularity in them and one of them is sinbad.This is likely a scam website that tries to ride on sinbad's popularity. Anyone who's going to use and deposit on them is likely to receive nothing and that deposit is gone forever. It can also happen into other mixers that these scammers will have their eyes on.

comments.author: notblox1
comments.body: Quote from: ajiz138 on April 07, 2023, 06:49:09 PMThere are no onion sites in this clone site.Contact, different from the official one.They could add their own fake onion website soon, but they are still going to be clone website.Maybe Sinbad have alternative domains but they would post them in bitcointalk forum, and they didnt do that so far.I saw this fake website have different email addresses than original, and I saw the same thing scammers did with fake chipmixer websites.

comments.author: Saisher
comments.body: Expect something like this in the mixing service they did it on Chipmixer, these scammers will also do it in other mixing services that is why I don't trust the search engine when it comes to giving us reliable results, they can put annoying ads that are similar to what we are searching in the internet, and if we are active on using a mixing service, bookmark it or compile it in your folder so you can go directly to the mixing service you're using when there is money involve expect scammers to create a clone for this.

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: That clone website seems to be not finished yet he forgot to put other pages like faq, news, and language choices.I believe this clone was made by other competitors who trying to hijack traffic.It is likely the same as what happened to Chipmixer there are lots of fake Chipmixer before.I think Sinbad should buy almost all domains near on their domain name to avoid this phishing and cloning.

comments.author: aioc
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on April 07, 2023, 11:56:15 PMThat clone website seems to be not finished yet he forgot to put other pages like faq, news, and language choices.I believe this clone was made by other competitors who trying to hijack traffic.It is likely the same as what happened to Chipmixer there are lots of fake Chipmixer before.I think Sinbad should buy almost all domains near on their domain name to avoid this phishing and cloning.That's a good idea but there are a lot of domain extensions and combinations of words to consider the list could go up to 20 or morethe best that Sinbad can do is for them to alert its users about these clone sites, and encourage them to bookmark the right Sinbad site since they have an active announcement here and running a signature campaign active mixer users are already aware of the right Sinbad extension, they should continue running their campaign for their visibility and avoid clone sites.

comments.author: CryptoGrizzly
comments.body: Thanks for providing this information. It's crazy how these types of fake (cloned) sites pop up here and there to scam people. I think it's important to check the WHOIS information on the domain name to see when it was actually registered.

comments.author: ajiz138
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on April 07, 2023, 11:56:15 PMThat clone website seems to be not finished yet he forgot to put other pages like faq, news, and language choices.You are right, clone sites never go away they will continue to be made when there are mixers that become new in popularity and that includes the sinbad mixer.There is another one I found recently cloned site with domain name mixersinbad.io but here have added FAQ, news and language options but still they have a different email from the original.Quote from: BitMaxz on April 07, 2023, 11:56:15 PMI believe this clone was made by other competitors who trying to hijack traffic.It is likely the same as what happened to Chipmixer there are lots of fake Chipmixer before.I think Sinbad should buy almost all domains near on their domain name to avoid this phishing and cloning.I don't know whether this is really their competition or there are scammers who deliberately make it without involving the original, but what is clear is that every time there is a popular mixing site there will be an imitation site and including sinbad which is now known on forums as popular mixing.This won't even be far from the previous mixer scam, which has been cloned a lot, but will the official Sinbad take this action so that its name remains clean from clone sites?

comments.author: RapTarX
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on April 07, 2023, 11:56:15 PMI think Sinbad should buy almost all domains near on their domain name to avoid this phishing and cloning.Not all the mixer cares a lot about their customers; don't know how Sinbad would take this suggestion but that's the best they can do. They should buy all the domains related to their domain name. That wouldn't cost them a lot unless they would try for some popular domain extension.Quote from: ajiz138 on April 08, 2023, 05:07:45 PMI don't know whether this is really their competition or there are scammers who deliberately make it without involving the original, but what is clear is that every time there is a popular mixing site there will be an imitation site and including sinbad which is now known on forums as popular mixing.This won't even be far from the previous mixer scam, which has been cloned a lot, but will the official Sinbad take this action so that its name remains clean from clone sites?I guess no competition; rather it's the scammer we used to see targeting popular mixers all the time. Now that ChipMixer shut down, they are looking for the rest LOL.

comments.author: khaled0111
comments.body: Buying similar domine names isn't a practical solution to prevent cybersquatting, imo. The same domains with other common TLDs have already been registered and buying them may cost a fortune. Besides, there is a high chance to miss some of them. So, this is only going to give customers a false sense of security believing that even if they make a typo they will be redirected to the real website.It's the visitors duty to check and double check the the URL before making a deposit. It's also the community's duty to report phishing websites.

comments.author: Potato Chips
comments.body: Quote from: khaled0111 on April 08, 2023, 08:34:06 PMBuying similar domine names isn't a practical solution to prevent cybersquatting, imo. The same domains with other common TLDs have already been registered and buying them may cost a fortune. Besides, there is a high chance to miss some of them. So, this is only going to give customers a false sense of security believing that even if they make a typo they will be redirected to the real website.It's the visitors duty to check and double check the the URL before making a deposit. It's also the community's duty to report phishing websites. Additionally, there are 1K+ TLDs out there not to mention, with each TLD there are multiple ways to create a similar SLD e.g. slnbad, sinbed, slnbed, sin-bad, sinbadmixer, mixersinbad, sinbad-mixer, etc. If they're gonna buy all/most related domain names, imagine how many is that? @-@Honestly, with people who don't have a habit of verifying links, there's a limit on how much baby sitting a website can do...

comments.author: robelneo
comments.body: Quote from: ajiz138 on April 08, 2023, 05:07:45 PMI don't know whether this is really their competition or there are scammers who deliberately make it without involving the original, but what is clear is that every time there is a popular mixing site there will be an imitation site and including sinbad which is now known on forums as popular mixing.Could be both scammers or competitors but it's not only in the mixing industry, even in casinos and the exchange industry cloning is very rampant, they can be reported on the host that's hosting the clone sites or here in Bitcointalk or other platforms, and if you're a mixer user you know that you can lose money if you landed in a clone mixer so it's your responsibility to always check the right mixer that you're dealing this applies to all platforms, you have to be a thinking internet user.QuoteThis won't even be far from the previous mixer scam, which has been cloned a lot, but will the official Sinbad take this action so that its name remains clean from clone sites?They are not the ones scamming but the clone mixing sites they can only do what they can do within their capacity it's still on the users to be responsible and knowledgeable users of the internet.

comments.author: yhiaali3
comments.body: Thanks for the warning, really good work, it's good that you made a thread about the phishing site because Sinbad has a signature campaign and got a good reputation, sure it has good traffic so many may fall victim to this scam.On the one hand, this indicates that Sinbad has gained a good reputation through the campaign because scammers usually create phishing sites for famous brands and names.It is difficult to avoid the problem except by exposing phishing sites and alerting people to make sure that the domain is 100% correct.

comments.author: Baofeng
comments.body: I try to look at this homoglyph or typo squatting, the first attack is this website:Code:https://simbad.io So if by chance, you go to your web browsers type and made the mistake or entering "m" instead of "n" you will be redirected to this fake website.Code:https://sinbad-mixer.io/So yes, this is very dangerous as anyone can fall for this trick if they are not careful enough to check the links or make the big mistake will searching for it in Google.

comments.author: SFR10
comments.body: Quote from: CryptoGrizzly on April 08, 2023, 01:39:05 PMI think it's important to check the WHOIS information on the domain name to see when it was actually registered.That's a good start, but it becomes a bit tricky when we're dealing with cloned sites that have been registered on the same day as the official one [in other words, we shouldn't solely rely on that information to protect us]!Quote from: ajiz138 on April 08, 2023, 05:07:45 PMThere is another one I found recently cloned site with domain name mixersinbad.io but here have added FAQ, news and language options but still they have a different email from the original.I also found another one that's "a few months older" than the above-cloned site [sinbad.digital] and it even has a blog [this doesn't exist in the official mixer]

comments.author: ajiz138
comments.body: Quote from: Baofeng on April 09, 2023, 11:24:31 PMSo yes, this is very dangerous as anyone can fall for this trick if they are not careful enough to check the links or make the big mistake will searching for it in Google.It is necessary to pay attention to the links that will be accessed, sometimes with Google search it is also misleading if they don't know the original, it would be better to visit this forum and go to the sinbad.io thread it will be much safer than searching on Google or any other search.Quote from: SFR10 on April 10, 2023, 02:35:20 PMI also found another one that's "a few months older" than the above-cloned site [sinbad.digital] and it even has a blog [this doesn't exist in the official mixer] This clone site is more perfect than what I found, they have added a lot including the onion site. LoLIt's getting rampant and now it's enough to be a concern and caution for those who want to search in any search.

comments.author: RapTarX
comments.body: Quote from: khaled0111 on April 08, 2023, 08:34:06 PMBuying similar domine names isn't a practical solution to prevent cybersquatting, imo. The same domains with other common TLDs have already been registered and buying them may cost a fortune. Besides, there is a high chance to miss some of them. So, this is only going to give customers a false sense of security believing that even if they make a typo they will be redirected to the real website.It's the visitors duty to check and double check the the URL before making a deposit. It's also the community's duty to report phishing websites. Popular TLDs wouldn't go for scam. Some of them are in use for purpose already. So, popular tlds aren't going to be a threat for sinbad. There will be few looks like domain and unpopular tlds which can pretend them.Anyway, it's not a total solution. It's a part of the solution.
